runs.comm: and it's 150kph right away. Short and wide, beats the cut from Rohit with the extra bounce
pace is your best friend, and pace is your best enemy... picked away off the pads for four through square leg... Just using the Tait pace
short at 149kmph, just outside off, left alone to bounce away

top edged for a six. Legendary short square boundaries of Adelaide Oval. Richardson at long leg gets under it, and even though it is going over he should have at least thrown back in before going over the rope. He just stepped on the rope, which did him in there
fast outswinger, left alone
another lovely outswinger, Rohit pushes at it, and is beaten
short of a length, just outside off, Dhawan gets a bottom edge on the cut... Takes the single
short of a length, outside off, nicely glided away to third man for one
short ball, doesn't quite come on, Dhawan ends up pulling in in front of square. Gets three runs for it
on a length, outside off, defended with an open face to point
mis-hit, but a safe mis-hit. Rohit knows mid-off is up, gets a ball in his swinging zone, and just lobs it over mid-off
lovely delivery. Short of a length, angling away, a bit of seam, and beats Dhawan's defence
Sgarma misses out on a leg-side offering. Similar delivery to the one he had clipped for four last over. The ball hits the pad. Sharma wants a leg-bye but is sent back
short of a length, wide, Sharma uses the pace of the ball and punches it through point. Between point and cover-point it goes
full and wide at 148ks, Sharma's drive is beaten by the outswing
beautiful outswinger. Nice dip on Sharma, he is not to the pitch of the ball is has his push beaten outside off
Richardson is being tested left, right and centre at long leg. Sharma cramped on the pull, he goes ahead with it, and just manages to place it fine of Richardson at long leg
short and wide, very wide, called a wide
this would have been a wide down the leg side, but Rohit plays at it, and gets a leading edge towards mid-on for one
swinging yorker, but too straight, and is clipped away off the toes for a couple
short of a length, slower ball, played off the hip for a single towards midwicket
wide half-volley, her is lucky he has a sweeper-cover to keep it to one
legcutter, short of a length, beats Rohit's attempt to play the cut with that spongy bounce

Boyce has dropped a sitter. The casino is just a walk from the Oval. Sharma should walk straight into the casino after the match. The head falls away as he slogs, and the top edge field towards third man where Boyce gets under it, but doesn't even get a hand to it. Total misjudgement
and here Sharma rubs salt into the wound. Plays a pick-up to a full ball over midwicket
short of a length, punched away off the hip to deep square leg

Welcome back Watto. He is celebrating again. He got a big wicket for Sydney Thunder in the BBL final not long ago, and he has got the big one. Sharma, who had nine lives, doesn't get another. The slower offcutter has been driven straight down the lap of mid-on
short of a length, outside off, steered to third man for one
wide length ball, driven to cover
absolutely smashed it with a cover-drive, but he has hit this straight to extra cover

two wickets in the first over for Watto. Those celebrations are back. Arms aloft. Slower bouncer, Dhawan shapes up to pull, but the ball hasn't arrived. He then looks to steer it, but is late on the attempt and the extra bounce takes the edge through to Wade
full outside off, pushed to mid-off. What an over from Watson
line goes wrong again. Wide down the leg side
short of a length, 151ks, no room, defended from the crease
short of a length, 151ks again, but provides Kohli that slightest bit of width. He has square-driven this on the up. Between point and cover-point
another wide down the leg side. Short of a length, looks to tuck him up, but slides too far
full outswinger at 147KS, defended from the crease
tucked away off the hip, fine of long leg, Faulkner runs around and puts a dive in to keep them down to two
short and wide, he is on his toes as he cuts this away to third man

Raina nearly walks into the trap. Moving away from the ball before it is let go, trying to get inside the line, expecting the bouncer, and then he fends it with a leg gully in place for just that. But he is lucky it has cleared the man there
short of a length, on off, opens the face to third man for one
short of a length, on off, defended with an open face
Raina mis-hits the hook, but he has opened up and deliberately tried to play it over midwicket where there are no fielders. Gets a couple
full, outside off, pushed down to long-off for one
short of a length, no room, pushed to mid-on
Kohli throws his bat at a shortish ball outside off, but is beaten. Doesn't quite get close to its line
shortish, Raina shapes up to pull, but the ball holds up a little. Raina adjusts well to punch it down to long-on
short of a length, cut away, Faulkner misfields at point to allow a single
front of the hand... full, pushed to long-on for one
Kohli is down the wicket, seems like he is half-beaten in the flight, but he manages to place the lifted drive over extra cover for four
flatter, punched into the leg side
short and wide, cut away to deep cover
and Raina goes after him right away. This is a Raina special. Down the wicket, and drives him inside-out, just out of the reach of the leaping Boyce at extra cover
slower ball, on off, steered away to third man
down the wicket to drive this length ball to long-off for one
slower legcutter, squares up Raina, who gets a thick edge towards point
slower full toss on the pads, helped away towards short fine leg where Tait comes down on it like London Bridge
not in control of the pull from head high, but it doesn't go up in the air. Gets a single to long leg
Kohli yorks himself by stepping out of the crease. Extra cover fields
stays back to a length ball, the cut goes straight to point
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, manages to play a drive to deep cover
down the wicket to take it on the full and drive it to long-off
down the wicket, too close to the pitch of the ball, hits it hard but doesn't get any elevation. A single to long-off
slog-sweeps but along the ground, gets a single to deep midwicket
on the pads, doesn't turn much, helped around the corner
short of a length, outside off, no turn, punched powerfully past extra cover for four
length ball, on the pads, worked to deep midwicket for one
down the wicket, mis-hits a flat ball to long-on for one
not to the pitch of the ball after jumping out of the crease, drives hard still, but Head makes a one-handed save to his left
worked towards deep midwicket, and Raina steals the second. Seems Warner's throw has come to the wrong end, Raina's. It is Kohli who is a little slow in setting off for the second
short of a length as Raina leaves the crease, pushed to deep midwicket
Kohli is not quite to pitch f this legbreak, he has not got this clean out of the screws, but he has backed his bat to send this over long-off. It just about evades that fielder
a better cleaner hit, along the ground to long-off for one
down the wicket to drag this to deep midwicket for one. Another mis-hit
this legbreak doesn't turn, hits the inside half of the bat and goes back to Boyce
half-volley, on the pads, driven towards deep midwicket
short, into the hip, punched away to long leg
skiddy short pull, hits the bottom edge on the pull. Rains is looking to drag this from outside off. Ends up playing it back to Watto
slower bouncer, 123ks, called wide for height. Has to be touch and go on that
short of a length, quick, hits the inside edge on to the pad
short of a length, Kohli is done in a little after having left this crease, but he recovers well t run this legcutter fine of short third leg
full outside off, driven to long-off for one
full, just outside off, a yorker. Raina looks to steer it. Beaten on the outside edge
short of a length, wide, and Kohli plays a superb back-foot drive over cover for four. Really powerful
this is even shorter, lets Kohli rocks back and cuts it past point for four
full and low, pushed towards long-on with soft hands. Rushes back for the second, brings up the fifty. Kohli's golden run continues
full toss outside off, Kohli has left the crease, which means he gets too close to it. Sends this back to Richardson
slower length ball, pushed past point for one
moves inside the line of a length ball, works it to leg, but sends it straight to square leg
short of a length, slower ball, runs it to short third
full and fast, beats Raina's slog, goes for a leg-bye
lovely slower bouncer, Kohli's hook is beaten, but he is not happy with the call to not wide it. Again touch and go as it was in the last over. Wided last over, fine this time
makes room to drive this full ball all along the carpet for a four. To the right of extra cover and to the left of long-off. That is a small gap. Really small gap. Kohli has pierced it
another superb shot. This is a length ball, around off, and Kohli has wristed it wide of long-on. Again there is a small gap between long-on and cow corner, but he has found it
driven to deep cover for one
and Kohli picks on the short square boundary. This is a small six, a parallel six. Picks it up off the toes. A length ball really. Uses all the pace of Tait to flick it over square leg
yorker this time, dug out for one
Raina moves inside the line anticipating the bouncer. Tait bowls one but well down the leg side
slower full toss, driven to deep cover
rapid short ball, pulled to long-on for one
Raina moves inside the line again, Tait bounces him down the leg side. Another wide
slower offcutter, hits the pad, goes for a legbye. Stifled appeal for lbw because this has clearly pitched outside leg
nearly a yorker, dug out to extra cover. They decide against the single
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for a single that takes the partnership to 100
slower ball, on a length, middle and leg, played with soft hands to long-on. Comes back for the second
full toss on the pads with the fine leg inside the circle. Tait denies Richardson the death wish by diving and making a save at short fine leg
Kohli down the wicket, beaten by a slower ball, but he manages to chip it over extra cover for two. Has recovered well again
yorker, on off, dug out for one to deep cover
yorker, just outside off, Raina is moving all over the crease, and in the end he is beaten on the attempted steer
length ball on the pads, flicked away to deep square for one
Raina targets the short square boundary, and he has absolutely smashed this. Slower ball, on a length, and he has slogged this right out of the screws
full, middle and leg, driven wide of long-off
yorker, on off, dug out for one to point
yorker, on the pads, goes off the front edge for one
full, middle and leg, nearly a yorker, dug out to deep midwicket
goes for the wide yorker, gives him a low full toss, which Raina has steered past point. Tait's effort from third man is stiff. Concedes the boundary
another low full toss, driven to deep cover
short of a length, slower ball, but too straight with fine leg inside the circle. Kohli just deflects this square of that short fine leg
yorker, dug out to long-on, and because it has gone off pace towards the fielder they steal the second. Had Richardson been behind the stumps he could have run Raina out
slower short ball but again too far down the leg side. Deflected past short fine leg for two
down the wicket, yorks himself, hits this hard at Richardson, and takes a single off the ricochet. Could have gone for the second but decides against it. Thirteen to go to the hundred
full, into the pads, drilled away to deep midwicket for one

Raina moves too far across and is bowled by a straight full toss. He has premeditated the ramp, but as he is bringing his bat across it hits the ground and gets a bit stuck there. Too late on the ball then
length ball on the pads, and Dhoni has gone deep into the crease to drill this over cow corner for a six first ball. Straight out of the screws
Kohli won't get a century. Wide length ball, and Dhhoni goes hard at it, and sends it over point for a four. Dhoni 10 off 2
yorker, middle and leg, dug out to deep midwicket. Kohli wants the second, but Dhoni sends him back
full toss, on the pads, hit wide of long-on for a couple. Kohli ends with a superlative 90
